meanings.definition: To absolve or pardon from sin.
meanings.sent1: The kind priest assoils the repentant sinner.
meanings.sent2: The judge assoils the defendant of all charges.
meanings.sent3: The magical fairy assoils the young girl's mistake with a wave of her wand.
meanings.sent4: The gentle rain seems to assoil the earth from its dusty sins.
meanings.sent5: The forgiveness in her eyes assoils him of his past wrongdoings.

meanings.definition: To free from guilt or blame.
meanings.sent1: The sincere apology assoils her of any wrongdoing.
meanings.sent2: The evidence presented in court assoils the accused of the crime.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected kindness of a stranger assoils him of his grudge.
meanings.sent4: The laughter of children can assoil any heavy heart from worries.
meanings.sent5: The warm hug seemed to assoil all the tension between them.
